resources.string: Grant camera permission to capture image
Uses Image Toolbox\'s elegant image picker

Storage permission required to access images
Delete Selected Images from Main Page After Stitching
Use SAF to Select Images Without Permissions
Your device uses this picker by default
Use multithreading to process images in parallel and improve stitching speed
Raise memory threshold to 80% of device\'s total RAM
Please select two or more images
Resolution exceeds limit!\nPlease select PNG format in settings

Service Availability: 
We do not guarantee that the app will be uninterrupted or error-free. The app may experience service interruptions due to technical updates, maintenance, or other force majeure events.

We do not collect personal information. 
You can use this app without providing any personal data. 
We do not share your personal data. 
Any revisions to this Privacy Policy will be published on the project‚Äôs GitHub repository and shall become effective with the corresponding app update, without prior or separate notification.

(Image Overlay Disabled) 
Stitch images directly according to the set direction (horizontal or vertical). 
Supports adjusting the image spacing (0‚Äì50px) and the overall scaling mode (uniform width for vertical stitching, uniform height for horizontal stitching). 

Min: Find the smallest alignment dimension (i.e., the minimum width or minimum height) among all images and scale all images proportionally to that size. 

Original: Maintain the original dimensions of each individual image. 

Max: Find the largest alignment dimension (i.e., the maximum width or maximum height) among all images and scale all images proportionally to that size.

Uses the first image as the base and overlaps the next image onto it. Useful for creating common video subtitle screenshots. \nYou can adjust the percentage (0‚Äì100%) of the next image\`s area to be overlaid.

Image stitching is subject to both the technical specifications of file formats and device memory limits. 
Please note: 

JPEG: The theoretical maximum size is 65,535 √ó 65,535 pixels (16-bit limit).The app outputs JPEG format by default. 

WebP: Whether lossless or lossy, its maximum size is typically limited to around 16,384 √ó 16,384 pixels. 

PNG: The theoretical maximum size is as high as 4,294,967,295 √ó 4,294,967,295 pixels (32-bit unsigned integer limit), theoretically the highest. 

‚ùóIf you have many images or large images, it is recommended to go to Settings and switch to PNG format, and enable the Increased Memory Threshold option. 

‚ùó‚ùó‚ùó Regardless of the format, the ultimate limitations in practice are the device\`s memory (RAM) and the Android Virtual Machine mechanism.The memory required to decode a very large image (width * height * 4 bytes/pixel) can easily cause the app to crash (OOM Crash).

Output Image Format: Supports PNG, JPEG, and WEBP. \n\nOutput Image Quality: The slider (1%-100%) only takes effect when the output format is JPEG or WEBP, and higher values produce higher quality images with larger file sizes.

Multithreading Acceleration: When enabled, image loading and stitching processes will be executed in parallel using Kotlin coroutines, which can significantly improve stitching speed. \n\nIncrease Memory Threshold: Raises the memory allocation upper limit for the stitching canvas from the default 50% to 80%, allowing for processing larger images, but increases the risk of OOM (Out Of Memory).

Auto Clear Selected Images: After stitching is complete, clear the selected images on the main page. 

Use Storage Access Framework Picker (SAF): Access files using the system file picker without requiring storage permissions. Suitable for privacy-conscious users. 

Embedded Picker: A powerful embedded picker extracted from the excellent ImageToolbox project. Solves issues like the system Photo Picker not showing all albums or having incorrect URI order. However, it requires storage permissions, and the initial load of album data might take a few seconds.
